text: A series of tellurides was evaluated as carbonic anhydrase (CA, EC 4.2.1.1) inhibitors against the human (h) carbonic anhydrase isoforms hCA I, II, IV, VII and IX, involved in a variety of diseases, including glaucoma, retinitis pigmentosa, epilepsy, arthritis and tumors. These compounds, which are the first tellurium-containing derivatives acting as inhibitors of carbonic anhydrase enzymes, showed effective inhibition against all isoforms investigated and some of them were selective for inhibiting the cytosolic or the membrane-bound CAs. Thus, these carbonic anhydrase inhibitors are interesting leads for the development of isoform-selective inhibitors.
title: First evaluation of organotellurium derivatives as carbonic anhydrase I, II, IV, VII and IX inhibitors.
